{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=July 2018}} {{Italic title}} {{Infobox play | name = Me Nathuram Godse Boltoy | image = Me Nathuram Godse Boltoy Cover.jpg | image_size = | image_alt = | caption = Poster | writer = Pradeep Dalvi | director = [[Vinay Apte]] | chorus = | characters = [[Nathuram Godse]] | mute = | setting = | premiere = <!-- {{Start date|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | place = | orig_lang = Marathi | series = | subject = | genre = | web = }} '''''Me Nathuram Godse Boltoy''''' is a two-act play written in the [[Marathi language]]. It has been written by Pradeep Dalvi (Mauli productions).<ref name="IE-20110205" /><ref name="HT-20110204">{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/Mumbai/Political-drama-surrounds-play-on-Nathuram-Godse/Article1-658335.aspx|title=Political drama surrounds play on Nathuram Godse|last=Kurian|first=Susamma|date=2011-02-04|publisher=HT Media|accessdate=9 April 2012|location=New Delhi|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130324235733/http://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/Mumbai/Political-drama-surrounds-play-on-Nathuram-Godse/Article1-658335.aspx|archivedate=24 March 2013|df=}}</ref> It is based on the book ''May It Please You Honour'' written by [[Gopal Godse]]. According to Karline McLain the play "enacts [[Nathuram Godse|Godse]]'s defense plea" and thus "explores the assassination of [[Gandhi]] and the trial of Godse from Godse's point of view.<ref name="McLain2009">{{cite book|author=Karline McLain|title=India's Immortal Comic Books: Gods, Kings, and Other Heroes|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=V4-Su0whKa0C&pg=PA192|accessdate=10 April 2012|date=11 February 2009|publisher=Indiana University Press|isbn=978-0-253-22052-3|pages=192}}</ref>
==Staging and controversies== In 1989 Dalvi was denied permission by the Maharashtra government to stage the play.<ref name="rediff-1998">{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/news/1998/jul/22godse.htm|title=The Rediff Special/Pradeep Dalvi An assassin speaks|year=1998|publisher=Rediff On the Net|accessdate=9 April 2012}}</ref> The play was first staged in 1997. It ran 13 successful shows but was banned thereafter, by the governments of [[Maharashtra]] and [[Kerala]].<ref name="Sehgal2003">{{cite book|author=Ikram ul-Majeed Sehgal|title=Defence journal|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=D6XfAAAAMAAJ|accessdate=10 April 2012|date=1 May 2003|publisher=Ikram ul-Majeed Sehgal}}</ref> The producer approached the high court in 1998, which permitted staging the play in 2001. The [[Supreme Court of India|Supreme Court]] upheld the high court's ruling.<ref name="DNA-20091226">{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report_gandhi-savarkar-don-green-hats-on-stage_1327572|title=Gandhi, Savarkar don green hats on stage|last=Siddhaye |first= Ninad |date=2009-12-26|publisher=Diligent Media Corporation Ltd.|accessdate=9 April 2012|location=Mumbai}}</ref> It was staged in [[Thane]]'s auditorium Gadkari Rangayatan in April 2001 facing opposition from parties like [[Indian National Congress]] and [[Nationalist Congress Party]]; it was not presented again in Thane until 2011. An [[Indian Express]] news story quotes director [[Vinay Apte]] regarding the intimidation that artists connected with the play faced, such as the incident when the bus used by the artists while touring was set on fire by Indian National Congress activists in [[Mulund]] a suburb of [[Mumbai]]. Despite this 627 shows were staged in other cities.<!--CONFUSING PHRASE, IS THIS 627 TOTAL, OR 629 WITH THE TWO THANE SHOWS "could be staged at places other than Thane" - WERE THEY ALL IN INDIA OR ALSO OTHER COUNTRIES??? --> In February 2011, the play re-opened to a packed house at the same Gadkari Rangayatan, in Thane. Two [[platoons]] of state reserve police and 350 regular policemen under the direction of senior officers provided security.<ref name="IE-20110205">{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/day-after-clash-producers-cancel-sunday-show/746363/0|title=Day after clash, producers cancel Sunday show|date=2011-02-05|publisher=The Indian Express Limited|accessdate=9 April 2012|location=Mumbai}}</ref><ref name="HT-20110204"/> According to [[Tushar Gandhi]], Gandhi's great-grandson, the play creates martyrs of murderers who after "murdering him ([[Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi]]) are now trying to murder his memory".<ref name="Outlook-19980727">{{cite web|url=http://www.outlookindia.com/article.aspx?205924|title=Villain As Hero|last=AKHTAR |first=SHAMEEM |date=1998-07-27|publisher=The Outlook Group|accessdate=9 April 2012|location=New Delhi}}</ref>It starred Sharad Ponkshe as Nathuram Godse.
==Criticism== Both the play and its ban have been criticized by [[Shriram Lagoo]] a view which was considered representative of the views of other theater workers such as [[Vijay Tendulkar]], [[Satyadev Dubey]] and [[Amol Palekar]] by [[The Times of India]] in its article ''Banning a play is not the solution''. Civil liberties activists have opposed the ban though they consider the play "vicious".<ref name="TOI-20011010">{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2001-10-10/mumbai/27255466_1_nathuram-godse-boltoy-government-bans-sakharam-binder|title='Banning a play is not the solution|date=2001-10-10|publisher=Bennett, Coleman & Co. Ltd.|accessdate=9 April 2012|location=Mumbai}}</ref>
===Nathuramayan=== [[Yashawant Dinkar Phadke]] in his book ''Nathuramayan'' has criticised Dalvi's play as presenting "distorted and falsified facts".<ref name="TOI-20020802">{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/keyword/nathuram-godse/featured/5|title=Nathuram Godse|date=2002-08-02|publisher=Bennett, Coleman & Co. Ltd.|accessdate=9 April 2012|location=Mumbai}}</ref> Political activists opposing the play have urged Dalvi to answer questions put forward by Phadke in ''Nathuramayan''.<ref name="HT-20110204" />
==References== {{reflist}}
{{Marathi Theatre}} {{Mahatma Gandhi}} [[Category:Entertainment in India]] [[Category:Marathi-language plays]] [[Category:Censorship in India]] [[Category:Indian plays]] [[Category:Works about the Mahatma Gandhi assassination]] [[Category:1997 plays]]

revision.comment: /* References */ I added this page to the category "Deaths by person in the United States."
revision.text:
{{pp-protected|reason=Persistent [[WP:Disruptive editing|disruptive editing]]: upping to 3 months based on protection log |small=yes}} {{pp-protected|reason=Persistent [[WP:Disruptive editing|disruptive editing]]|small=yes}} {{Use American English|date=November 2018}} {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox civilian attack | title = Murder of XXXTentacion | partof = | location = [[Deerfield Beach, Florida]], U.S. | image = {{Location map | Florida#USA | width = 220 | float = center | alt = | label = Deerfield Beach | mark = | coordinates = {{coord|26|27|56|N|80|11|45|W|region:US-FL_type:airport|display=it}} }} {{-}} {{OSM Location map |coord={{Coord|26.275621|-80.1145748}} |float=center |zoom=15 |width=250 |height=160 |scalemark=40 |mark-coord1 = {{Coord|26.275621|-80.1145748}} | shape1=n-circle | shape-color1=blue | shape-outline1=white | caption = Location of XXXTentacion's murder in Deerfield Beach, Florida }} | type = [[murder]], possible [[Robbery|armed robbery]] | victim = [[XXXTentacion|Jahseh Onfroy]] | date = {{start date|mf=yes|2018|6|18}} | time = 5:00 p.m. | timezone = [[Eastern Time Zone|EDT]] | susperps = Dedrick Devonshay Williams
Michael Boatwright
Robert Allen
Trayvon Newsome | weapon = [[.22 Long Rifle|.22 LR]] [[semi-automatic pistol]], [[Short-barreled rifle]] }} On June 18, 2018, American rapper [[XXXTentacion]], real name Jahseh Dwayne Ricardo Onfroy, was shot and killed in an apparent robbery, just outside RIVA Motorsports, an upscale seller of motorcycles and boats in [[Deerfield Beach, Florida]]. He was shot once in the neck{{Cite news|url=https://www.vibe.com/2018/06/xxxtentacion-shot-in-the-neck/|title=XXXTentacion Murder Witness Says Rapper Was Shot In Neck|date=2018-06-20|work=Vibe|access-date=2018-06-24}} and was in critical condition before being pronounced dead at exactly 5:30 p.m. ==Events== On June 18, Onfroy went to a bank to withdraw money before heading to RIVA Motorsports, an upscale seller of motorcycles and boats in [[Deerfield Beach, Florida]].{{Cite news |url=https://miami.cbslocal.com/2018/06/19/vigil-slain-rapper-xxxtentcion/ |title=Vigil Held For Slain Local Rap Artist XXXTentcion |date=June 19, 2018|access-date=June 20, 2018 |language=en}} After withdrawing money from a bank, he was followed by a dark-colored [[Dodge Journey]] SUV allegedly containing Dedrick Williams, Robert Allen, Michael Boatwright, and Trayvon Newsome.{{Citation |last=XXL |title=XXXTentacion Dead at 20 After Being Shot |date=June 19, 2018 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KoTZ1cn2DKA|access-date=June 20, 2018}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.nme.com/news/music/new-details-in-xxxtentacion-murder-emerge-2342949|title=New details in XXXTentacion's murder emerge - NME|date=2018-06-23|work=NME|access-date=2018-06-24|language=en-US}} At 3:30 p.m. EDT, Onfroy arrived at RIVA Motorsports and entered with his friend.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/22/arts/music/xxxtentacions-killers-charged.html|title=XXXTentacion‚Äôs Killers Tracked Him as He Entered Motorcycle Dealership|access-date=2018-06-24|language=en}} Robert Allen followed Onfroy inside the store to confirm that it was Onfroy inside the BMW.{{Cite news|url=https://www.hotnewhiphop.com/xxxtentacions-killers-were-tracking-him-surveillance-footage-released-news.60866.html|title=XXXTentacion's Killers Were Tracking Him: Surveillance Footage Released|work=HotNewHipHop|access-date=2018-09-28}} Two minutes later, Newsome and Boatwright allegedly left the SUV and followed Onfroy inside before Williams bought the masks used during the robbery at a local convenience store. A half an hour later, Onfroy left the dealership, entered his black [[BMW i8]]{{Cite news |url=https://miami.cbslocal.com/2018/06/19/search-gunmen-rapper-xxxtentacion/ |title=Search Is On For Gunmen Who Shot, Killed Rapper XXXTentacion |date=June 19, 2018|access-date=June 20, 2018 |language=en}} and began to drive away from the dealership. The SUV drove in front of Onfroy's car, blocking him in while Newsome and Boatwright exited the vehicle and demanded property from Onfroy. A brief struggle ensued, which resulted in Onfroy being allegedly shot once in the neck by Boatwright.{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/xxxtentacion-dead-murder-latest-killers-tracked-rapper-dedrick-devonshay-williams-orange-sandals-a8413236.html|title=Police reveal how XXXTentacion's killers tracked rapper in final moments before fatal shooting|work=The Independent|access-date=2018-06-24|language=en-GB}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/06/18/entertainment/rapper-xxxtentacion-shot-dead/index.html |title=XXXTentacion Shot in Apparent Robbery |work=CNN |date=June 18, 2018|access-date=June 18, 2018}} Witnesses told police Newsome and Boatwright took a [[Louis Vuitton]] bag from Onfroy's vehicle and then fled while Onfroy's friend exited the vehicle and ran away from the crime scene.{{Cite news|url=https://www.vibe.com/2018/06/xxxtentacion-shot-in-the-neck/|title=XXXTentacion Murder Witness Says Rapper Was Shot In Neck|date=2018-06-20|work=Vibe|access-date=2018-06-24}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.hotnewhiphop.com/xxxtentacion-reportedly-died-instantly-after-being-shot-in-the-neck-news.53162.html|title=XXXTentacion Reportedly Died Instantly After Being Shot In The Neck|work=HotNewHipHop|access-date=2018-06-24}} The shooting occurred in east of the city of [[Parkland, Florida|Parkland]] where Onfroy was living at the time.{{Cite news |url=https://www.spin.com/2018/06/xxxtentacion-shot-miami/ |title=XXXTentacion Shot in Miami: TMZ |date=June 18, 2018 |work=Spin|access-date=June 18, 2018}}{{cite web |last1=Lockett |first1=Dee |title=Report: XXXTentacion Dead Following Shooting |url=http://www.vulture.com/2018/06/report-xxxtentacion-was-shot-and-is-in-critical-condition.html |website=Vulture |accessdate=June 18, 2018}} The [[Broward County]] [[Broward County Sheriff's Office#Fire, rescue and emergency services|Fire Department]] rushed him to the nearby [[Broward Health North]].{{cite web |URL=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/news/rapper-xxxtentacion-shot-in-broward-county-tmz-reports-10451838 |title=Rapper XXXTentacion Shot Dead in Broward County}} Onfroy was initially reported to be in critical condition following the shooting,{{Cite news |url=https://noisey.vice.com/en_us/article/a3a8y8/xxxtentacion-reportedly-shot-in-miami |title=XXXTentacion Reportedly Shot in Miami |date=June 18, 2018 |work=[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]]|access-date=June 18, 2018 |language=en-us}} but the [[Broward County Sheriff's Office]] later confirmed his death.{{cite news |last1=Linsalata |first1=Nicole |author2=[[Associated Press]] |date=June 18, 2018 |title=Rapper XXXTentacion shot dead in Deerfield Beach |url=https://wsvn.com/entertainment/report-rapper-xxxtentacion-shot-in-deerfield-beach/|dead-url=no |department=Entertainment |work=[[WSVN]] |publisher=[[Sunbeam Television]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180619124205/https://wsvn.com/entertainment/report-rapper-xxxtentacion-shot-in-deerfield-beach/|archive-date=June 19, 2018|access-date=June 19, 2018}} ==Investigation== Shortly following the announcement of Onfroy's death, Broward County Sheriff's Office offered a $3,000 [[Bounty (reward)|bounty]] for any information leading to the arrest of any suspects. Originally, many fans of Onfroy's, numerous internet users & local residents suspected local Florida rappers Soldier Kidd and Soldier Jojo to be the killers of Onfroy due to several suspicious [[Instagram]] posts made by the pair with specific details that corroborated with witness reports, but these accusations were dropped when Dedrick Williams and Michael Boatwright (the alleged shooter) were arrested.{{Cite news |url=https://www.vibe.com/2018/06/broward-county-sheriff-xxxtentacion/ |title=Broward Sheriff Offers $3000 Reward In XXXTentacion Murder Case |date=June 19, 2018 |work=Vibe|access-date=June 21, 2018}} On June 20, 2018, the [[Broward County Sheriff's Office]] arrested 22-year-old Dedrick Devonshay Williams in connection with Onfroy's murder.{{cite news |title=XXXTentacion: Suspect arrested in rapper murder case |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-44565813 |date=June 21, 2018 |access-date=June 23, 2018 |work=[[BBC News]] |publisher=[[BBC]]}} Williams was driving in his silver 2004 Honda before a traffic stop occurred.{{Cite news |url=http://www.itv.com/news/2018-06-21/man-appears-in-court-charged-with-murdering-rapper-xxxtentacion/ |title=Man appears in court charged with murdering rapper XXXTentacion |work=ITV News|access-date=June 21, 2018 |language=en}} Williams was detained in the car chase that followed.{{Cite web |url=https://pitchfork.com/news/xxxtentacion-murder-suspect-arrested-report/ |title=XXXTentacion Murder Suspect Arrested {{!}} Pitchfork|website=pitchfork.com|language=en|access-date=June 21, 2018}} Williams was identified by clothing he wore on June 18, which included orange sandals and a white tank top. The police matched images from security footage to recent pictures from Williams‚Äô Instagram feed, which featured ‚Äúthe same or similar bright orange sandals‚Äù. He was also identified by employees who saw him enter RIVA Motorsports to buy a [[neoprene]] mask.{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/hip-hop/8462391/xxxtentacions-court-documents-dedrick-devonshay-williams-motorcycle-dealership|title=New Court Documents Reveal XXXTentacion's Killers Followed Him Into Motorcycle Dealership|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-06-24}} After Williams' arrest, two more active warrants were issued.{{Cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/21/arts/music/xxxtentacion-arrest-murder-charge.html |title=Suspect, 22, Arrested in Florida in Killing of XXXTentacion|access-date=June 21, 2018 |language=en}} On June 27, 22-year-old Robert Allen was named as a [[person of interest]] in the case, and was later arrested on July 26.{{Cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/police-name-person-of-interest-in-xxxtentacion-murder-report/|title=Police Name Person of Interest in XXXTentacion Murder: Report {{!}} Pitchfork|website=pitchfork.com|language=en|access-date=2018-06-27}} On July 5, 22-year-old Michael Boatwright was also arrested by the Broward County Sherriff's Office. Originally, he was arrested on drug-related charges, but on July 10, a warrant was put out for him related to the death of Onfroy. Police believe that Boatwright was the one who fatally shot Onfroy.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/police-make-second-arrest-rapper-xxxtentacion-s-murder-n890536|title=Florida police make second arrest in rapper XXXTentacion's murder|work=NBC News|access-date=2018-07-11|language=en-US}} The three men were later indicted by a [[grand jury]], alongside a fourth, for Onfroy's death.{{cn|date=October 2018}} On August 7, 20-year-old Trayvon Newsome was later arrested for his involvement in the murder. Newsome and Boatwright are the alleged shooters.{{cite news |author= |date=July 19, 2018 |title=Grand Jury Indicts 4 Men in XXXTentacion Murder |url=http://www.tmz.com/2018/07/19/xxxtentacion-murder-four-suspects-indicted/ |work=TMZ |access-date= July 20, 2018}} ==Legal proceedings== {{expandsect|date=October 2018}} Dedrick Williams was charged with [[first degree murder]], [[probation violation]], and was denied [[bail]].{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-44565813 |title=Suspect arrested over XXXTentacion death |date=June 21, 2018 |work=BBC News|access-date=June 21, 2018 |language=en-GB}}{{cite web |url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2018/06/suspect-arrested-xxxtentacion-murder |title=Suspect Arrested for XXXTentacion's Murder ‚Äì XXL |website=XXL Mag |accessdate=June 21, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.nzherald.co.nz/entertainment/news/article.cfm?c_id=1501119&objectid=12076155 |title=Tattoo artist suspect denied bail in the shooting death of rapper XXXTentacion |author= |date=June 22, 2018 |publisher=''The New Zealand Herald''}} On June 25, he pled not guilty.{{cite web |url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2018/06/suspect-pleads-not-guilty-in-xxxtentacion-murder/ |title=Suspect Pleads Guilty in Murder of XXXTentacion |last=Mojica |first=Nick |date=June 27, 2018 |website=XXL Mag}} ==Aftermath== Following the announcement of Onfroy's murder, a makeshift memorial was quickly created by fans and local residents, consisting of lyrics from the artist and words of remembrance written in [[Sidewalk chalk|chalk]] stretching up to a hundred yards. The owner of RIVA Motorsports, where Onfroy was killed, held a vigil on June 19, 2018.{{Cite web |url=https://www.local10.com/news/florida/deerfield-beach/vigil-held-tuesday-for-rapper-gunned-down-in-deerfield-beach |title=Vigil held Tuesday for rapper gunned down in Deerfield Beach |last=Forney |first=Amanda Batchelor, Sanela Sabovic, Terrell |website=www.local10.com |language=en-US|access-date=June 19, 2018}} Hundreds gathered during the vigil and Broward County Sheriffs were forced to close the street. Shortly after, a walk commenced between Onfroy's fans. Onfroy's house in Parkland, Florida, which was being built at the time, was also memorialized by fans.{{Cite web |url=https://wtop.com/life-style/2018/06/the-latest-candles-teddy-bear-left-on-slain-singers-porch/ |title=WTOP {{!}} The Latest: Fans gather at the site of XXXTentacion‚Äôs slaying|website=wtop.com|language=en-US|access-date=June 20, 2018}} Onfroy's team issued a statement saying a proper memorial service would be arranged soon.{{Cite news |url=https://www.vibe.com/2018/06/xxxtentacion-memorial-service-information/ |title=XXXTentacion's Team Says A Memorial Service Date Is Forthcoming |date=June 19, 2018 |work=Vibe|access-date=June 20, 2018}} Internet personality [[Adam Grandmaison]] (better known as Adam22), the creator of the podcast ''No Jumper,'' for which Onfroy had his first professional interview, held a memorial a day after Onfroy's death in front of his [[Freestyle BMX|BMX]] retail store OnSomeShit on [[Melrose Avenue]] in [[Los Angeles]] to a crowd of 300 people.{{Cite news |url=https://twitter.com/ktla/status/1009281086268952576?s=21 |title=KTLA on Twitter |work=Twitter|access-date=June 20, 2018 |language=en}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Fv6z8DoA2I|title=XXXtentacion Memorial turns into a Riot|work=[[YouTube]], uploaded by No Jumper|date=June 20, 2018 |accessdate=July 18, 2018}} The crowd eventually grew to over 1,000 and police in riot gear eventually appeared with police en route to disperse the crowd.{{Cite news |url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/los-angeles-xxxtentacion-memorial-1202851814/ |title=Hundreds Gather in Los Angeles to Remember XXXTentacion |last=Nyren |first=Erin |date=June 20, 2018 |work=Variety|access-date=June 20, 2018 |language=en-US}} According to reports, rubber bullets were shot and tear gas was used to disperse the crowd.{{Cite news |url=http://ktla.com/2018/06/19/crowd-of-300-takes-to-the-street-in-fairfax-district-amid-memorial-for-slain-rapper-xxxtentacion/ |title=Throng of Hundreds Shuts Down Melrose Avenue Amid Memorial for Slain Rapper XXXTentacion |date=June 20, 2018 |work=KTLA|access-date=June 20, 2018 |language=en-US}} ===Funeral=== [[File:Mausoleum_of_XXXTentacion.png|thumb|right|180px|Onfroy's mausoleum]] An open casket service for Onfroy took place at [[BB&T Center (Sunrise, Florida)|BB&T Center]] in [[Sunrise, Florida|Sunrise]], Florida on June 27th where fans were allowed to pay their respects.{{cite web|url=http://www.vulture.com/2018/06/xxxtentacion-fans-invited-to-memorial-at-florida-stadium.html|title=XXXTentacion Fans Invited to Open Casket Memorial at Florida Panthers Stadium|work=[[New York (magazine)#Digital expansion and blogs|Vulture.com]]|first=Kiefer|last=Halle|accessdate=July 9, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-44638859|title=XXXTentacion fans queue to pay respects at Florida service|work=[[BBC News]]|date=June 28, 2018|accessdate=July 9, 2018}} His private funeral took place a day later, where rappers [[Lil Uzi Vert]], [[Lil Yachty]], [[Denzel Curry]] and singer [[Erykah Badu]] were among the attendees.{{cite web|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/948004/xxxtentacion-laid-to-rest-in-private-funeral-after-shooting|title=XXXTentacion Laid to Rest in Private Funeral After Shooting|work=[[E! News]]|author=Mike Vulpo|date=June 28, 2018|accessdate=July 9, 2018}} He was laid to rest in a grey [[mausoleum]] at the Gardens of Boca Raton Memorial Park, in [[Boca Raton, Florida|Boca Raton]], Florida.{{cite web|url=https://theblast.com/xxxtentacion-private-funeral-featured-police-protection/|title=XXXTentacion Private Funeral Featured Police Protection|work=The Blast|authors=Gary Trock, Melissa Parrelli|date=July 2, 2018|accessdate=July 9, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sun-sentinel.com/news/florida/fl-reg-xxxtentacion-grave-mausoleum-20180701-story.html|title=XXXTentacion's mausoleum gravesite revealed in Instagram photo by his mother|work=[[Sun-Sentinel]]|author=Brett Clarkson|date=July 1, 2018|accessdate=July 9, 2018}} ===Commercial impact=== On June 19, the day after Onfroy‚Äôs death, ''Billboard'' reported that [[Taylor Swift]]'s [[Spotify]] single-day streaming record for "[[Look What You Made Me Do]]" was broken by Onfroy's track "[[Sad!]]", with over 10.4 million streams compared to Swift's 10.1 million streams.{{Cite news |url=https://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/news/digital-and-mobile/8461988/xxxtentacion-breaks-taylor-swifts-single-day-streaming |title=XXXTentacion Breaks Taylor Swift's Single-Day Streaming Record on Spotify |work=Billboard|access-date=June 21, 2018 |language=en}}{{Cite web |url=https://pitchfork.com/news/xxxtentacion-breaks-taylor-swifts-spotify-streaming-record/ |title=XXXTentacion Breaks Taylor Swift‚Äôs Spotify Streaming Record {{!}} Pitchfork|website=pitchfork.com|language=en|access-date=June 21, 2018}} This was followed by a 16-fold sales increase across all streaming and download platforms, including a 7000-fold sales increase in CDs on [[Amazon.com]].{{Cite news |url=https://eu.usatoday.com/story/life/people/2018/06/20/xxxtentacion-mourn-rapper-memorial-killers/716971002/ |title=XXXTentacion shooting: Rapper's music sales skyrocket 1,603% as fans hold impromptu vigils |work=USA TODAY|access-date=June 21, 2018 |language=en}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/bryanrolli/2018/06/19/xxxtentacion-album-sales-skyrocket-following-death/#59db518b3d1b |title=XXXTentacion's Amazon Album Sales Skyrocket More Than 700,000% Following His Death |last=Rolli |first=Bryan |work=Forbes|access-date=June 21, 2018 |language=en}} Onfroy's album ''[[? (XXXTentacion album)|?]]'' was expected to return to the top five the week of his death following his murder, ultimately reaching number three with 90,000 album-equivalent units sold, up from 19,000 the last week.{{Cite news |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8462010/beyonce-jay-z-5-seconds-of-summer-billboard-200 |title=Beyonce & JAY-Z vs. 5 Seconds of Summer for No. 1 on Billboard 200 Albums Chart |work=Billboard|access-date=June 21, 2018}} In the week following his murder, Onfroy's highest-charting single, "Sad!" , went from 52nd to 1st on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100, making him the first artist to top the Hot 100 posthumously in a lead role since [[The Notorious B.I.G.]], with "[[Mo Money Mo Problems]]", in 1997.{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8462525/xxxtentacion-sad-no-1-hot-100|title=XXXTentacion's 'Sad!' Vaults From No. 52 to No. 1 on Billboard Hot 100 Following Rapper/Singer's Death|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-06-25}} On June 28, his management team posthumously released the music video for "Sad!", which has received over 90 million views whilst the audio has over 520 million views. ==See also== {{Portal bar|Death|Criminal justice|Hip hop|Music|Florida|United States}} *[[List of killed hip hop musicians]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{XXXTentacion}} [[Category:2018 in Florida]] [[Category:2018 murders in the United States]] [[Category:Crime in Florida]] [[Category:June 2018 crimes in the United States]] [[Category:Attacks in the United States in 2018]] [[Category:Filmed killings]] [[Category:Filmed deaths of entertainers]] [[Category:Deerfield Beach, Florida]] [[Category:Deaths by person in the United States]]

{{unreliable sources|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox website | name = MyOutdoorTV | logo = My_Outdoor_TV_logo.png | logocaption = | screenshot = | collapsible = | collapsetext = | caption = | url = {{URL|www.myoutdoortv.com}} | type = [[Sports broadcasting]] | registration = | language = | num_users = | content_license = | owner = [[Kroenke Sports & Entertainment]] | author = | editor = | launch_date = 2006 | alexa = | revenue = | current_status = Active | footnotes = }} '''MyOutdoorTV.com''' is an internet television channel that provides streaming TV shows and product demonstrations to [[hunting|hunters]], [[shooting sports]] enthusiasts, [[angling|anglers]], [[camping|campers]], [[boating|boaters]], and [[hiking|hikers]]. It is the largest online video network catering to outdoor programming.
MyOutdoorTV.com carries many outdoor-related cable shows that air on Outdoor Channel and [[Sportsman Channel]] via the online video channel.
Access is $9.99 per month to all programming. The channel has been described as the [[Netflix]] of the hunting world.
==History== The channel was launched in 2006 by David Hall and Chris Moise, former programming executives from [[The Nashville Network|TNN]] and [[Country Music Television|CMT]] and at launch featured programming hosted by Hank Parker, Mark Sosin, Jimmy Houston, Larry Csonka, Roland Martin, Babe Winkelman, and others as well as a dozen radio shows and links to more than 150 outdoor blogs including a viewer created encyclopedia called "MyOutdoorWiki".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tvover.net/2007/07/26/MyOutdoorTV+Launches+Online+Video+Network.aspx |title=MyOutdoorTV Launches Online Video Network |publisher=TVover.net |date=2007-07-26 |accessdate=2018-09-20}}</ref> It was acquired by [[Outdoor Channel]] in 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.outdoorchannel.com/Hunting/News/Outdoor-Channel-Holdings-Acquires-MyOutdoorTV-com.aspx|title=Outdoor Channel Holdings Acquires MyOutdoorTV.com - Outdoor Channel|first=Outdoor|last=Channel|website=www.outdoorchannel.com}}</ref> Outdoor Channel was later acquired by [[Kroenke Sports & Entertainment]] where the channel was made part of its [[Outdoor Sportsman Group]] collection.
MyOutdoorTV.com which was originally headquartered in [[Tennessee]] is now headquartered in [[Denver, Colorado]], part of the Kroenke Sports & Entertainment family of companies.
==Controversy== The channel stirred controversy upon launch in the [[United Kingdom]] on July 31, 2017, where Kroenke owns part the [[Premier League]] team [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] for its showing of "[[blood sports]]". The channel was condemned by British animal rights groups. My Outdoor TV defended its programming "MOTV will present ethical, fair chase hunting and as long as it's legal it will be on there." "If you like hunting elephants, there will be legal elephant hunts, ethical elephant hunts, shown in that context."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/07/31/arsenal-owner-stan-kroenke-faces-criticism-launching-sickening/|title=Arsenal owner Stan Kroenke faces criticism after launching 'sickening' trophy hunting TV channel|first=Telegraph|last=Sport|date=31 July 2017|publisher=|via=www.telegraph.co.uk}}</ref> There were calls to boycott the Arsenal club over the channel's content.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/4136743/arsenal-boycott-stan-kroenke-tv-channel-my-outdoor-tv/|title=Threat to boycott Arsenal as owner Stan Kroenke launches sick TV channel in UK|date=31 July 2017|publisher=}}</ref>

{{about|the category of words|the comic character|Onomatopoeia (comics)}} {{pp-semi-indef|small=yes}}
[[File:Clocks no tic tac.JPG|thumb|right|A sign in a shop window in Italy proclaims "No Tic Tac", in imitation of the sound of a clock.]] '''Onomatopoeia''' ({{IPAc-en|audio=en-us-onomatopoeia.ogg|Àå|…í|n|…ô|Àå|m|√¶|t|…ô|Àà|p|iÀê|…ô|,_|-|Àå|m|…ëÀê|-}};<ref>{{citation |last=Wells |first=John C. |year=2008 |title=Longman Pronunciation Dictionary |edition=3rd |publisher=Longman |isbn=978-1-4058-8118-0}}</ref><ref>{{citation |last=Roach |first=Peter |year=2011 |title=Cambridge English Pronouncing Dictionary |edition=18th |place=Cambridge |publisher=Cambridge University Press |isbn=978-0-521-15253-2}}</ref> from the [[Greek language|Greek]] ·ΩÄŒΩŒøŒºŒ±œÑŒøœÄŒøŒπŒØŒ±;<ref>[http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.04.0057%3Aentry%3Do%29nomatopoii%2Fa ·ΩÄŒΩŒøŒºŒ±œÑŒøœÄŒøŒπŒØŒ±], Henry George Liddell, Robert Scott, ''A Greek-English Lexicon'', on Perseus</ref> ·ΩÑŒΩŒøŒºŒ± for "name"<ref>[http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.04.0057%3Aentry%3Do%29%2Fnoma ·ΩÑŒΩŒøŒºŒ±], Henry George Liddell, Robert Scott, ''A Greek-English Lexicon'', on Perseus</ref> and œÄŒøŒπŒ≠œâ for "I make",<ref>[http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.04.0057%3Aentry%3Dpoie%2Fw œÄŒøŒπŒ≠œâ], Henry George Liddell, Robert Scott, ''A Greek-English Lexicon'', on Perseus</ref> [[adjectival form]]: "onomatopoeic" or "onomatopoetic") is the process of creating a word that [[phonetics|phonetically]] imitates, resembles, or suggests the sound that it describes. As such words are [[uncountable noun]]s, ''onomatopoeia'' refers to the property of such words. Common occurrences of words of the onomatopoeia process include animal noises such as "oink", "miaow" (or "meow"), "roar" and "chirp". Onomatopoeia can differ between languages: it conforms to some extent to the broader [[natural language|linguistic]] system;<ref>[http://muse.jhu.edu/login?auth=0&type=summary&url=/journals/new_literary_history/v027/27.3bredin.html Onomatopoeia as a Figure and a Linguistic Principle], Hugh Bredin, The Johns Hopkins University, Retrieved November 14, 2013</ref><ref>[http://literarydevices.net/onomatopoeia/ Definition of Onomatopoeia], Retrieved November 14, 2013</ref> hence the sound of a clock may be expressed as ''tick tock'' in [[English language|English]], ''tictac'' in [[Spanish language|Spanish]], ''dƒ´ dƒÅ'' in [[Standard Chinese|Mandarin]], ''katchin katchin'' in [[Japanese language|Japanese]], or "tik-tik" in [[Hindi language|Hindi]].
Although in the English language the term '''onomatopoeia''' means "the imitation of a sound", the compound word ''onomatopoeia'' (·ΩÄŒΩŒøŒºŒ±œÑŒøœÄŒøŒπŒØŒ±) in the Greek language means "making or creating names". For words that imitate sounds, the term ·Ω¥œáŒøŒºŒπŒºŒ∑œÑŒπŒ∫œå (echomimetico) or [[echomimetic]]) is used. The word ·Ω¥œáŒøŒºŒπŒºŒ∑œÑŒπŒ∫œå (echomimetico) derives from "·Ω¥œáœé", meaning echo or sound, and "ŒºŒπŒºŒ∑œÑŒπŒ∫œå", meaning mimetic or imitating.
== Uses == [[File:Noveltyitems.JPG|thumb|A bang flag gun, a humouristic [[novelty item]]]] {{further|List of animal sounds}}
In the case of a [[frog]] croaking, the spelling may vary because different frog species around the world make different sounds: [[Ancient Greek]] ''brekekekex koax koax'' (only in Aristophanes' comic play ''The Frogs'') probably for [[marsh frog]]s; English ''[[wikt:ribbit|ribbit]]'' for species of frog found in North America; English verb ''[[wikt:croak|croak]]'' for the [[common frog]].<ref>{{citation |url=http://www.yale.edu/ynhti/curriculum/units/2000/5/00.05.11.x.html |title=Basic Reading of Sound Words-Onomatopoeia |publisher=Yale University |date= |accessdate=October 11, 2013}}</ref>
Some other very common English-language examples are ''hiccup'', ''zoom'', ''bang'', ''beep'', ''moo'', and ''splash''. [[Machine]]s and their sounds are also often described with onomatopoeia: ''honk'' or ''beep-beep'' for the horn of an automobile, and ''vroom'' or ''brum'' for the engine. In speaking of a mishap involving an audible [[electric arc|arcing]] of electricity, the word "zap" is often used (and its use has been extended to describe non-auditory effects generally connoting the same sort of localized but thorough{{clarify|date=May 2017}} interference or destruction similar to that produced in short-circuit sparking).
Human sounds sometimes provide instances of onomatopoeia, as when ''mwah'' is used to represent a kiss.<ref name="mwah_ocford">[https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/mwah English Oxford Living Dictionaries]</ref>
For animal sounds, words like ''[[Quack (sound)#Communication|quack]]'' ([[duck]]), ''moo'' (cow), ''[[Bark (utterance)|bark]]'' or ''woof'' (dog), ''[[Roar (utterance)|roar]]'' ([[lion]]), ''[[meow]]''/''[[miaow]]'' or ''[[purr]]'' (cat), ''cluck'' ([[chicken]]) and ''baa'' (sheep) are typically used in English (both as nouns and as verbs).
Some languages flexibly integrate onomatopoeic words into their structure. This may evolve into a new word, up to the point that the process is no longer recognized as onomatopoeia. One example is the English word "bleat" for sheep noise: in [[medieval]] times it was pronounced approximately as "blairt" (but without an R-component), or "blet" with the vowel drawled, which more closely resembles a sheep noise than the modern pronunciation.
An example of the opposite case is "[[cuckoo]]", which, due to continuous familiarity with the bird noise down the centuries, has kept approximately the same pronunciation as in [[Old English language|Anglo-Saxon]] times and its vowels have not changed as they have in the word ''furrow''.
''[[Verbum dicendi|Verba dicendi]]'' ("words of saying") are a method of integrating onomatopoeic words and [[ideophone]]s into grammar.
Sometimes, things are named from the sounds they make. In English, for example, there is the universal fastener which is named for the sound it makes: the [[zipper|zip]] (in the UK) or [[zipper]] (in the U.S.) Many birds are named after their calls, such as the [[bobwhite quail]], the [[weero]], the [[morepork]], the [[killdeer]], [[chickadee]]s and [[jay]]s, the [[common cuckoo|cuckoo]], the [[common chiffchaff|chiffchaff]], the [[whooping crane]], the [[whip-poor-will]], and the [[kookaburra]]. In [[Tamil language|Tamil]] and [[Malayalam]], the word for [[crow]] is ''kaakaa''. This practice is especially common in certain languages such as [[MƒÅori language|MƒÅori]], and so in names of animals borrowed from these languages.
=== Cross-cultural differences === Although a particular sound is heard similarly by people of different cultures, it is often expressed through the use of different consonant strings in different languages. For example, the ''snip'' of a pair of scissors is ''cri-cri'' in Italian, ''riqui-riqui'' in Spanish, ''terre-terre'' or ''treque-treque'' in Portuguese, ''krits-krits'' in modern Greek and ''katr-katr'' in Hindi.<ref>Earl Anderson, ''A Grammar of Iconism'', Fairleigh Dickinson, 1999</ref> Similarly, the "honk" of a car's horn is ''ba-ba'' ([[Han characters|Han]]: Âè≠Âè≠) in Mandarin, ''tut-tut'' in [[French language|French]], ''pu-pu'' in Japanese, ''bbang-bbang'' in [[Korean language|Korean]], ''b√¶rt-b√¶rt'' in [[Norwegian language|Norwegian]], ''fom-fom'' in Portuguese and ''bim-bim'' in [[Vietnamese language|Vietnamese]].
=== Onomatopoeic effect without onomatopoeic words === An onomatopoeic effect can also be produced in a phrase or word string with the help of [[alliteration]] and [[literary consonance|consonance]] alone, without using any onomatopoeic words. The most famous example is the phrase ''"furrow followed free"'' in [[Samuel Taylor Coleridge]]'s ''[[The Rime of the Ancient Mariner]]''. The words "followed" and "free" are not onomatopoeic in themselves, but in conjunction with "furrow" they reproduce the sound of ripples following in the wake of a speeding ship. Similarly, alliteration has been used in the line ''"as the surf surged up the sun swept shore..."'', to recreate the sound of breaking waves, in the poem "I, She and the Sea".
== Comics and advertising == [[File:CRAC w.jpg|thumb|A sound effect of breaking a door]] [[Comic strip]]s and [[comic book]]s make extensive use of onomatopoeia. Popular culture historian Tim DeForest noted the impact of writer-artist [[Roy Crane]] (1901‚Äì1977), the creator of ''[[Captain Easy]]'' and ''[[Buz Sawyer]]'': :It was Crane who pioneered the use of onomatopoeic sound effects in comics, adding "bam," "pow" and "wham" to what had previously been an almost entirely visual vocabulary. Crane had fun with this, tossing in an occasional "ker-splash" or "lickety-wop" along with what would become the more standard effects. Words as well as images became vehicles for carrying along his increasingly fast-paced storylines.<ref>{{cite book |last=DeForest |first=Tim |title=Storytelling in the Pulps, Comics, and Radio: How Technology Changed Popular Fiction in America |publisher=McFarland |year=2004 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=1xAXWwYchscC&pg=PA115&dq=%22wash+tubbs%22&lr=&as_drrb_is=q&as_minm_is=0&as_miny_is=&as_maxm_is=0&as_maxy_is=&num=100&as_brr=0&cd=2#v=onepage&q=%22wash%20tubbs%22&f=false}}</ref>
In 2002, [[DC Comics]] introduced a villain named [[Onomatopoeia (comics)|Onomatopoeia]], an athlete, martial artist, and weapons expert, who often speaks pure sounds.
[[Advertising]] uses onomatopoeia for [[mnemonic]] purposes, so that consumers will remember their products, as in [[Alka-Seltzer]]'s "Plop, plop, fizz, fizz. Oh, what a relief it is!" jingle, recorded in two different versions (big band and rock) by [[Sammy Davis, Jr.]]
[[Rice Krispies]] (US and UK) and [[Rice Bubbles]] (AU){{clarify|date=May 2017}} make a "snap, crackle, pop" when one pours on milk. During the 1930s, the illustrator [[Vernon Simeon Plemion Grant|Vernon Grant]] developed [[Snap, Crackle and Pop]] as gnome-like mascots for the [[Kellogg Company]].
Sounds appear in road safety advertisements: "clunk click, every trip" (click the seatbelt on after clunking the car door closed; UK campaign) or "click, clack, front and back" (click, clack of connecting the [[seat belt]]s; AU campaign) or "click it or ticket" (click of the connecting seat belt, with the implied penalty of a traffic ticket for not using a seat belt; US DOT (Department of Transportation) campaign).
The sound of the container opening and closing gives [[Tic Tac]] its name.
=== Manner imitation === {{Main|Ideophone}} In many of the world's languages, onomatopoeic-like words are used to describe phenomena beyond the purely auditive. Japanese often uses such words to describe feelings or figurative expressions about objects or concepts. For instance, Japanese ''barabara'' is used to reflect an object's state of disarray or separation, and ''shiiin'' is the onomatopoetic form of absolute silence (used at the time an English speaker might expect to hear the sound of [[cricket (insect)|crickets]] chirping or a pin dropping in a silent room, or someone coughing). It is used in English as well with terms like ''[[bling]]'', which describes the glinting of light on things like gold, chrome or precious stones. In Japanese, ''kirakira'' is used for glittery things.
== Examples in media == * [[James Joyce]] in ''[[Ulysses (novel)|Ulysses]]'' (1922) coined the onomatopoeic ''tattarrattat'' for a knock on the door.<ref name="Joyce1982">{{cite book |author=James Joyce |title=Ulysses |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=VZdOUXIOBhwC&pg=PT434 |year=1982 |publisher=Editions Artisan Devereaux |isbn=978-1-936694-38-9 |pages=434‚Äì |quote=...I was just beginning to yawn with nerves thinking he was trying to make a fool of me when I knew his tattarrattat at the door he must ...}}</ref> It is listed as the longest [[palindromic]] word in ''[[The Oxford English Dictionary]]''.<ref name="Booty2002">{{cite book |author=O.A. Booty |title=Funny Side of English |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=PVcHzENuAnMC&pg=PT203 |date=1 January 2002 |publisher=Pustak Mahal |isbn=978-81-223-0799-3 |pages=203‚Äì |quote=The longest palindromic word in English has 12 letters: tattarrattat. This word, appearing in the [[Oxford English Dictionary]], was invented by [[James Joyce]] and used in his book ''[[Ulysses (novel)|Ulysses]]'' (1922), and is an imitation of the sound of someone [farting].}}</ref> * ''[[Whaam!]]'' (1963) by [[Roy Lichtenstein]] is an early example of [[pop art]], featuring a reproduction of comic book art that depicts a fighter aircraft striking another with rockets with dazzling red and yellow explosions. * In the 1960s TV series ''[[Batman (TV series)|Batman]]'', comic book style onomatopoeic words such as ''wham!'', ''pow!'', ''biff!'', ''crunch!'' and ''zounds!'' appear onscreen during fight scenes. * [[Ubisoft]]'s ''[[XIII (video game)|XIII]]'' employed the use of comic book onomatopoeic words such as ''bam!'', ''boom!'' and ''noooo!'' during gameplay for gunshots, explosions and kills, respectively. The comic-book style is apparent throughout the game and is a core theme, and the game is an adaptation of [[XIII (comics)|a comic book of the same name]]. * The chorus of American popular songwriter [[John Prine]]'s song "Onomatopoeia" cleverly incorporates onomatopoeic words (though as discussed, 'ouch!' is not the sound of pain): "Bang! went the pistol. | Crash! went the window. | Ouch! went the son of a gun. | Onomatopoeia | I don't wanna see ya | Speaking in a foreign tongue." * The marble game [[KerPlunk (game)|KerPlunk]] has an onomatopoeic word for a title, from the sound of [[marbles]] dropping when one too many sticks has been removed. * The [[Nickelodeon]] cartoon's title ''[[KaBlam!]]'' is implied to be onomatapoeic to a crash. * Each [[List of Harper's Island episodes|episode]] of the TV series ''[[Harper's Island]]'' is given an onomatopoeic name which imitates the sound made in that episode when a character dies. For example, in the episode titled ''"Bang"'' a character is shot and fatally wounded, with the "Bang" mimicking the sound of the gunshot. * ''[[Mad (magazine)|Mad]]'' Magazine cartoonist [[Don Martin (cartoonist)|Don Martin]], already popular for his exaggerated artwork, often employed comic-book style onomatopoeic "sound effects" in his drawings (for example, "thwizzit" is the sound of a sheet of paper being yanked from a typewriter). Fans have compiled [http://www.madcoversite.com/dmd.html ''The Don Martin Dictionary''], cataloguing each "sound" and its "meaning".
== Cross-linguistic examples == {{Main|Cross-linguistic onomatopoeias}}
== In linguistics == A key component of language is its arbitrariness and what a word can represent{{clarify|date=May 2017}}, as a word is a sound created by humans with attached meaning to said sound.<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Assaneo |first=Mar√≠a Florencia |last2=Nichols |first2=Juan Ignacio |last3=Trevisan |first3=Marcos Alberto |date=2011-01-01 |title=The anatomy of onomatopoeia |journal=PLoS One |volume=6 |issue=12 |pages=e28317 |doi=10.1371/journal.pone.0028317 |issn=1932-6203 |pmc=3237459 |pmid=22194825}}</ref> No one can determine the meaning of a word purely by how it sounds. However, in onomatopoeic words, these sounds are much less arbitrary; they are connected in their imitation of other objects or sounds in nature. Vocal sounds in the imitation of natural sounds doesn't necessarily gain meaning, but can gain symbolic meaning.{{clarify|date=May 2017}}<ref name=":0">{{Cite journal |last=RHODES |first=R |date=1994 |title=Aural Images |url= |journal=In J. Ohala, L. Hinton & J. Nichols (eds.) Sound Symbolism. Cambridge, UK: Cambridge University Press |volume= |pages=}}</ref> An example of this [[sound symbolism]] in the English language is the use of words starting with ''sn-''. Some of these words symbolize concepts related to the nose (''sneeze'', ''snot'', ''snore''). This does not mean that all words with that sound relate to the nose, but at some level we recognize a sort of symbolism associated with the sound itself. Onomatopoeia, while a facet of language, is also in a sense outside of the confines of language.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |url=http://eds.a.ebscohost.com/eds/detail/detail?sid=a6add37f-bf5b-4b3d-a431-9adb50d76cd5@sessionmgr4006&vid=12&hid=4203&bdata=JnNpdGU9ZWRzLWxpdmUmc2NvcGU9c2l0ZQ==#AN=88455764&db=ufh |title=The Study of Onomatopoeia in the Muslims' Holy Write: Qur'an: OneSearch for Articles, Books, and More |website=eds.a.ebscohost.com |language=en |access-date=2017-02-27}}</ref>
In linguistics, onomatopoeia is described as the connection, or symbolism, of a sound that is interpreted and reproduced within the context of a language, usually out of mimicry of a sound.<ref name=":2">{{Cite journal |last=Bredin |first=Hugh |date=1996-08-01 |title=Onomatopoeia as a Figure and a Linguistic Principle |url=https://muse.jhu.edu/article/24304 |journal=New Literary History |volume=27 |issue=3 |pages=555‚Äì569 |doi=10.1353/nlh.1996.0031 |issn=1080-661X}}</ref> It is a figure of speech, in a sense. Considered a vague term on its own, there are a few varying defining factors in classifying onomatopoeia. In one manner, it is defined simply as the imitation of some kind of non-vocal sound using the vocal sounds of a language, like the hum of a bee being imitated with a ‚Äúbuzz‚Äù sound. In another sense, it is described as the phenomena of making a new word entirely.
Onomatopoeia works in the sense of symbolizing an idea in a phonological context, not necessarily constituting a direct meaningful word in the process.<ref name=":3">{{Cite journal |last=Laing |first=C. E. |date=2014-09-15 |title=A phonological analysis of onomatopoeia in early word production |url=http://fla.sagepub.com/cgi/doi/10.1177/0142723714550110 |journal=First Language |language=en |doi=10.1177/0142723714550110}}</ref> The symbolic properties of a sound in a word, or a [[phoneme]], is related to a sound in an environment, and are restricted in part by a language's own phonetic inventory, hence why many languages can have distinct onomatopoeia for the same natural sound. Depending on a language‚Äôs connection to a sound's meaning, that language‚Äôs onomatopoeia inventory can differ proportionally. For example, a language like English generally holds little symbolic representation when it comes to sounds, which is the reason English tends to have a smaller representation of sound mimicry then a language like Japanese that overall has a much higher amount of symbolism related to the sounds of the language.
== The evolution of language == In ancient Greek philosophy, onomatopoeia was used as evidence for how natural a language was: it was theorized that language itself was derived from natural sounds in the world around us. Symbolism in sounds was seen as deriving from this.<ref name=":4">{{Cite journal |last=Osaka |first=Naoyuki |year=1990 |title=Multidimensional Analysis of Onomatopoeia -A note to make sensory scale from word |url=http://repository.kulib.kyoto-u.ac.jp/dspace/bitstream/2433/52479/1/soa024_025.pdf |journal=Studia phonologica |volume= |pages=25‚Äì33 |via=Kyoto University Research Information Repository}}</ref> Some linguists hold that onomatopoeia may have been the first form of human language.<ref name=":1" />
In the development of a language, sounds that are associated with natural objects then go on to form words with related meanings.<ref name=":0" /> For example, ''gl-'' at the beginning of an English word can denote something that is shining or iridescent (e.g. glitter, glisten, gleam).{{dubious|date=May 2017}}
== Role in early language acquisition == When first exposed to sound and communication, humans are biologically inclined to mimic the sounds they hear, whether they are actual pieces of language or other natural sounds.<ref name=":5">{{Cite journal |last=Assaneo |first=Mar√≠a Florencia |last2=Nichols |first2=Juan Ignacio |last3=Trevisan |first3=Marcos Alberto |date=2011-12-14 |title=The Anatomy of Onomatopoeia |url=http://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0028317 |journal=PLoS ONE |volume=6 |issue=12 |pages=e28317 |doi=10.1371/journal.pone.0028317 |issn=1932-6203 |pmc=3237459 |pmid=22194825}}</ref> Early on in development, an infant will vary his/her utterances between sounds that are well established within the phonetic range of the language(s) most heavily spoken in their environment, which may be called "tame" onomatopoeia, and the full range of sounds that the vocal tract can produce, or "wild" onomatopoeia.<ref name=":3" /> As one begins to acquire one's first language, the proportion of "wild" onomatopoeia reduces in favor of sounds which are congruent with those of the language they are acquiring.
During the native language acquisition period, it has been documented that infants may react strongly to the more wild-speech features to which they are exposed, compared to more tame and familiar speech features. But the results of such tests are inconclusive.
In the context of language acquisition, sound symbolism has been shown to play an important role.<ref name=":0" /> The association of foreign words to subjects and how they relate to general objects, such as the association of the words takete and baluma{{Fix|text=are these arbitrary nonsense words which are used in tests?}} with either a round or angular shape{{clarify|date=May 2017}}, has been tested to see how languages symbolize sounds.{{clarify|date=May 2017}}
== In other languages ==
=== Japanese === Onomatopoeia, or ''giongo'' in Japanese, is common in the Japanese language, from day to day conversation to serious news.<ref>Inose, Hiroko. "Translating Japanese Onomatopoeia and Mimetic Words." N.p., n.d. Web.</ref> In general, onomatopoeia in Japanese can be categorized into three types: * ''Giseigo'': mimics humans and animals. (e.g. ''WanWan'' for a dog's bark) * ''Giongo'': mimics general noises in nature or inanimate objects. (e.g. ''zaazaa'' for rain on a roof) * ''Gitaigo'': describes states of being, not sounds. (e.g. ''mushimushi'', uncomfortably warm) Japanese also uses a system of sound symbolic words called mimetics. Though not entirely different from onomatopoeia, words that are mimetic are generally distinguished from onomatopoeia. Mimetic, or ''gitaigo'' in Japanese, words are a phonological representation of some kind of state of being, or something that doesn't exactly make sound.{{clarify|date=May 2017}}
Sometimes Japanese onomatopoeia produces reduplicated words.<ref name=":4" />
=== Malay === There is a documented correlation within the Malay language of onomatopoeia that begin with the sound bu- and the implication of something that is rounded. As well as with the sound of -lok within a word conveying curvature in such words like lok, kelok and telok (locomotive, cove and curve respectively).<ref name=":6">{{Cite journal |last=WILKINSON |first=R. J. |date=1936-01-01 |title=ONOMATOPOEIA IN MALAY |jstor=41559855 |journal=Journal of the Malayan Branch of the Royal Asiatic Society |volume=14 |issue=3 (126) |pages=72‚Äì88}}</ref>
=== Arabic === Within the Qur'an, written in Arabic, instances of onomatopoeia are documented.<ref name=":1" /> Out of about 77,701 words, there are 9 words that are onomatopoeic, 3 which are animal sounds (e.g. "mooing"), 2 which are sounds of nature (e.g. "thunder") and 4 that are human sounds (e.g. "whisper" or "groan").

{{citation style|date=September 2015}} '''''Playboy's Dark Justice''''' is a half-hour, computer-animated, [[softcore pornographic]] TV series shown on [[Playboy TV]] premiering on September 3, 2000,<ref>[http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-64972595.html Cable World Programming Briefs August 21, 2000]</ref> and running for 20 (of an intended 26) episodes until 2001, and was perhaps the first and only show of its kind created. Unlike most talk, variety, and reality series on Playboy TV, ''Dark Justice'' had characters and story arcs. It featured a heroine named Justina (voiced by [[Veronica Hart]]), who would fight crime as part of a [[vigilante]] force in a [[dystopian]] world in Metro City in 2120.<ref>[http://media.corporate-ir.net/media_files/nys/pla/reports/PBY-FLSH/revised/PbyAr2000.pdf Playboy Financial Highlights 2000, page 12]</ref> The plots inevitably led to Justina and others in sexual situations. The series was directed by [[Michael Ninn]], with Robert C. England as technical director, lead animator, motion-capture actor, and the voice of Wendell,{{cn|date=February 2016}} and produced by Ninn and Hart (among others) through Hope Ranch Productions, and featured a number of porn stars as voice actors and models for [[motion capture]] animated with [[3D Studio Max]] and [[Character Studio]].<ref>[http://www.linkedin.com/pub/james-beylik/57/888/50b James Beylik| LinkedIn]</ref><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20090728010338/http://geocities.com/jamesbeylik James Beylik]</ref><ref>[http://www.loop.la/foro3/viewtopic.php?f=10&t=453&start=60 Post by Juan Duque]</ref>
''Dark Justice'' was the only completed film and television production from Hope Ranch until its acquisition by Pure Play Media in 2002 and name change to [[Ninn Worx]].<ref>[https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1328784/000112785506000394/pureplayexh10_10.htm PURE PLAY SB-2, LOAN/SECURITY AGREEMENT AMENDMENT]</ref><ref>[http://www.productionhub.com/profiles/details/175979 Ali Alavi: About Me]</ref> The name "Hope Ranch" appears to have been later used for the [[alternate reality game]] Kronos480BC promoting the Ninn Worx production "The Four".<ref>[http://www.argn.com/tag/kronos480bc Alternate Reality Gaming Meets the Adult Entertainment Industry with Kronos480BC]</ref>
==Characters== *Justina [https://web.archive.org/web/20020325001914/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/justina_text.jpg] *Lacy White [https://web.archive.org/web/20020325011944/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/lacy_text.jpg] *Trevor & Wendell [https://web.archive.org/web/20020325045051/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/trevor_text.jpg] *The Sarge [https://web.archive.org/web/20020325035002/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/sarge_pict-text.jpg] *Lance Larson *Lonnie Lovet *Lou Stone [https://web.archive.org/web/20020325021502/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/lou_text.jpg] *Taffy Dugan *Mayor Julio Camarones [https://web.archive.org/web/20020821225923/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/mayor_text.jpg] *Chili "Bean" Johnson [https://web.archive.org/web/20020221005705/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/chili_text.jpg]
===Villains=== *Mr. Big [https://web.archive.org/web/20020325060239/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/villians_pictpg1-1.jpg] *Morell Dekay [https://web.archive.org/web/20011208005419/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/villians_pictpg1-2.jpg] *Miz Behave [https://web.archive.org/web/20011208005825/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/villians_pictpg2-1.jpg] *Won Hung Low [https://web.archive.org/web/20011208010233/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/villians_pictpg2-2.jpg] *Regina [https://web.archive.org/web/20011210090740/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/villians_pictpg3-1.jpg] *Doctor Dick [https://web.archive.org/web/20020221014606/http://playboy.com/pbtv-hv/pbtv/darkjustice/imx/characters/villians_pictpg3-2.jpg]

{{Multiple issues|{{refimprove|date=June 2017}}{{Self-published|date=June 2017}}}}
'''Pokhara International Mountain Film Festival''' is a three-day-plus film festival held in the city of [[Pokhara]] in [[Nepal]].<ref>http://infonepal.net/english/112855/</ref> This non-competitive film festival showcases documentaries, and feature films that deals with environment and culture of the [[Himalayas]].<ref>http://thehimalayantimes.com/nepal/pokhara-international-mountain-film-festival-kicks-off-pokhara/</ref>
The festival, organized by Pokhara Film Society, happens usually towards the end of December every year.<ref>http://www.annapurnapost.com/annanote/news/2589/International-Mountain-Film-Festival-kicks-off-in-Pokhara</ref> Besides Pokhara, the films are also shown in other cities of [[Nepal]] like [[Manang]], [[Mustang]], [[Ghale Gaun]] and [[Ghandruk]].<ref>http://www.icimod.org/?q=25140</ref>
==2014==
The festival was held on December 10 to 12, at The Mountain Museum, [[Gharipatan]], [[Pokhara]], and was jointly organized by The Pokhara Film Society and The Federation of Film Societies of Nepal. 25 and documentaries from 11 different countries were screened during the three-day event.
==2015==
The festival was not conducted in 2015 due to the [[April 2015 Nepal earthquake]] and the six-month-long inhumane blockade.
==2016==
The 2016 IMFF was organized from 21 to 23 December, and a total of 52 films and documentaries from 22 countries were screened.<ref>http://www.pokharaimff.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/PIMFF-Screening-Schedule-to-Print.pdf</ref>
{| class="wikitable" |- | A Song for Barpak [[Nepal]] || Naya Jhul [[Nepal]] || Laaz [[Nepal]] |- | Dhartiputra [[Nepal]] || Mela [[Nepal]] || Dadyaa: The Woodpeckers of Rotha [[Nepal]] |- | Mirror [[Nepal]] || Mirror [[Nepal]] || Mirror [[Nepal]] |- | Forging Bonds [[United States]] || Forging Bonds [[Italy]] || Forging Bonds [[UK]] |}

revision.text:
{{Underlinked|date=September 2015}}
'''Reader's theatre''' or '''Reader's theater''' is a style of [[theater]] in which the [[actor]]s do not memorize their lines. Actors use only vocal expression to help the audience understand the story rather than visual storytelling such as sets, costumes, intricate blocking, and movement. This style of performance of literature was initially lauded because it emphasized hearing a written text as a new way to understand literature. ==History== Readers Theatre is also known as [[Chamber theatre|Chamber Theatre]] or [[Interpretive Theatre]]. Readers Theatre became popular during and following the [[Second World War]] when resources to produce plays were scarce. There are four different types of Readers Theatre, each an evolution of the former and each with different attributes: Readers Theatre, Free Readers Theatre, Chamber Theatre, and Contemporary Readers Theatre. Each of these styles and manifestations of Readers Theatre are still performed today.
The original Readers Theatre was presented using only scripts and stools or chairs. The material performed was plays, poems, narrative fiction, and non-dramatic literature. The performers' focus was offstage and limited costuming was sometimes used (often the readers wore all black to strip away character and allow for more focus on vocal interpretation of the piece). While the readers may have interpreted the scenes or poems cold, in most cases the scripts were memorized and rehearsals were conducted with even more intensity than those conducted for a regular play. There was little to no interaction between performers or movement. This style of performance also helped performers deal with [[performance anxiety]].<ref>Walker, Rebecca. "Readers Theatre Presentation." Performance History. Southern Illinois University Carbondale. 14 April 2014. Lecture.</ref>
Free Readers Theater was a little more free than traditional Readers Theater. The materials performed were all the same except plays were no longer performed. The performers were now able to look at and interact with each a little more and the presence of scripts was optional. Blocking began to appear which suggested psychological relationships between characters and pictorial compositions (for example, if two characters hated each other, they might be at opposite ends of the stage, and as the tension rises, they might move toward each other). The performers still wore black, but some wore additional costume pieces to help suggest character (such as a hat or shawl).<ref>Walker, Rebecca. "Readers Theatre Presentation." Performance History. Southern Illinois University Carbondale. 14 April 2014. Lecture.</ref>
Chamber Theater focused on narrative fiction only (no other type of material was performed). Scripts were almost always memorized (a narrator might carry a script to make their authoritative voice). The movement became more elaborate and could be associated with more traditional theater practices; it was used in such a way to reveal the character's role and relationships in the story. Costuming evolved into suggested or full costumes.<ref>Walker, Rebecca. "Readers Theatre Presentation." Performance History. Southern Illinois University Carbondale. 14 April 2014. Lecture.</ref>
Contemporary Readers Theatre is commonly practiced today. It is less bound by convention and uses techniques from all of the above traditions of Readers Theatre. It is influenced by performance art techniques which is to say there is an increasing emphasis on creating a critical performance that interrogates the text instead of being faithful to it and doing a good representation to share the meaning with the audience. Contemporary Readers Theatre is influenced by [[Augusto Boal]] who emphasized creating interactive improvisational performances where the emphasis is on the performers and audiences' reaction to the central theme of the performance.<ref>Walker, Rebecca. "Readers Theatre Presentation." Performance History. Southern Illinois University Carbondale. 14 April 2014. Lecture.</ref>
==Theatre in Education==
According to some drama teachers,{{who|date=March 2013}} plays have built-in strategies to help students improve their reading skills. The acting out of dialogue causes readers to work more closely with the text to project and interpret meaning into the reading experience. Consequently, students gain improvement in vocabulary, comprehension and retention. Reading in a small group provides reading role models which is also proven to improve reading skills in students. Research has shown that Readers Theatre can improve reading fluency, word choice and comprehension.<ref>[http://teacher.scholastic.com/products/instructor/readerstheater.htm The Power of Readers Theater<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.ed.gov/admins/lead/read/rb/edlite-slide019.html Archived: Improving Fluency - Research-Based Instruction in Reading<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.nifl.gov/partnershipforreading/publications/PFRbooklet.pdf (pages 24-29)]</ref>
One of the foremost authors on Readers Theatre was Dr. Leslie Irene Coger. Dr. Coger wrote the book ''Readers Theatre Handbook: A Dramatic Approach to Literature.'' <ref>[http://eric.ed.gov/ERICWebPortal/search/detailmini.jsp?_nfpb=true&_&ERICExtSearch_SearchValue_0=ED089286&ERICExtSearch_SearchType_0=no&accno=ED089286 Readers Theatre Handbook: A Dramatic Approach to Literature. Revised Edition<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
== Dr. Leslie Irene Coger == Dr. Coger, mentioned above as one of the foremost authors on Readers Theatre, began studying expression at the age of nine with a local instructor, Gladys Anderson. In the 1930s, she attended the Curry School of Expression in Boston. She received her Ph.D. in 1952 and spent much of her career as a professor at Southwest Missouri State University. Her retirement was followed by Missouri governor Kit Bond naming July 11, 1981 "Leslie Irene Coger Day," and in 1982, Southwest Missouri State University named its new theatre after her. In 1989, she was inducted into the College of Fellows of the American Theatre. In 1994, she received the Distinguished Service Award from the Performance Studies division of the National Communication Association (NCA).
Dr. Coger tracks the rise of Reader's Theatre as part of the larger shifts in her field, beginning with "expression" in the 1930s, to "oral interpretation" in the late 1940s, to simply "interpretation" in the late 1950s and 1960s. In the wake of New Criticism, the "interpretation" era focused on works of fiction and analysis of literature, and the study of persona, narrators, and the implied author. This turn gave the discipline room for group performances alongside solo performance of interpretations, including styles such as Chamber Theatre, Theatre of the Mind, and, as Dr. Coger writes in her handbook, Readers Theatre.
Finally, Dr. Coger tracks the shift in the 1990s from "interpretation" to "performance studies" the field as we know it today.<ref>Coger, Leslie Irene. "From Elocution to Performance Studies: A Personal History." ''Future of Performance Studies: Visions and Revisions''. Ed. Sheron Dailey. Annadale, VA: National Communication Association, 1998. 110 - 113. Print.</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}} http://readerstheater.com/CEE_Summer_Literacy_Report_2014.pdf http://www.readerstheater.com/research.html
==External links== * http://www.freereaderstheater.com * http://www.readerstheater.com

{{Infobox amusement park | name = Salitre Magico | image = Parque Salitre.JPG | caption = Diversion Extrema | location = [[Parque El Salitre]] | location2 = [[Bogot√°]] | location3 = [[Colombia]] | coordinates = | homepage = {{URL|salitremagico.com.co}} | owner = [[Corporaci√≥n Interamericana de Entretenimiento|Corporaci√≥n Interamericana de Entretenimiento - Operadora de Centros de Espect√°culos, S.A. de C.V. Ocesa, M√©xico.]] | operator = CIE | general_manager = Nestor Bermudez | opening_date = January, 2000 | closing_date = | previous_names = Parque El Salitre | season = | area = | rides = 39 | coasters = 3 | water_rides = }} '''Salitre Magico''' is an [[amusement park]] located in [[Bogot√°]], [[Colombia]] inside the territory of the Parque el Salitre. Currently it has 39 mechanical attractions such as roller coasters, [[bumping cars]], and the unique "Castillo del Terror" (Castle of Horror). It was one of the most important and classic<ref>[http://www.bogotaturismo.gov.co/atractivos/parques/zona_occidente.php#salitre Bogot√° Turismo:Salitre M√°gico] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20040829021412/http://www.bogotaturismo.gov.co/atractivos/parques/zona_occidente.php |date=2004-08-29 }} Consultado el 1 de Febrero de 2010</ref> amusement parks of the city, as well as the largest,<ref>{{cite book|title=Etiqueta negra: una revista para distra√≠dos|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=5Ns2AAAAYAAJ|year=2006|publisher=Pool Producciones|page=94}}</ref> among some others such as the [[Mundo Aventura]] and the [[Cici Aquapark]].
==History== Inaugurated in 1973 under the name of "Parque El Salitre",<ref name="Villegas2002">{{cite book|author=Benjamin Villegas|title=Bogot√° from the Air|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=b7-SNfrR4-wC&pg=PT209|year=2002|publisher=Villegas Asociados|isbn=978-958-8156-22-4|pages=209‚Äì}}</ref> and located between the 68th Avenue and the 63rd Street, near the [[Parque Simon Bolivar]] in [[Bogot√°]]. It was then considered as one of the most modern parks on [[Latin America]]. Some years later, the park was closed to the public in 1999, in order to be remodeled.
Its reinauguration took place in December 2000, under a new name "Salitre M√°gico" and under the Mexican firm CIE,<ref name="Clav√©2007">{{cite book|author=Salvador Anton Clav√©|title=The Global Theme Park Industry|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=rH-wmRzn6AcC&pg=PA86|year=2007|publisher=CABI|isbn=978-1-84593-208-4|pages=86‚Äì}}</ref> with a total of 29 rides located all over the park, among these there was a roller coaster nicknamed "the Screw" due to its helicoidal form which was imported from the United States and reassembled in [[Bogot√°]]; some other new attractions such as a giant Chicago Wheel called the "Rueda Millenium" (Millennium Wheel) with a total height of 40 m which offers a panoramic view of the city. The Salitre Magico also offers aquatic attractions and a wide variety of mechanical attractions and shows for children and the whole family. Close to the Salitre Magico, a brother park was inaugurated, the Cici Aquapark, which offers aquatic attractions including a sea waves simulator and several sledges. Both parks are currently part of the Mexican emporium [[Corporacion Interamericana de Entretenimiento]].
==Rides== [[File:727 Avianca Salitre Magico.jpg|thumb|Avianca [[Boeing 727]] plane on Salitre M√°gico.]] Among the wide variety of rides, the park offers entertainment for children with attractions such as the [[Carousel]], Flying Swings, and mini-Wheel; some other of high impact such as the three Roller coasters, the Tornado, the Double Loop and the Screw which counts with free falls up from 15 m height and a total round of 500 m.
==References== {{reflist}} * http://www.lafm.com.co/bogot√°-y-cundinamarca/noticias/denuncian-caso-discriminaci√≥n
== External links == * {{official website|http://www.salitremagico.com.co}} {{es icon}}
{{coord|4.6682|N|74.0910|W|source:wikidata|display=title}}

'''Score Productions''' is an [[United States of America|American]] musical production company specializing in background [[music]] and themes for [[television series|television programs]]. Started in 1963 by music producer Robert A. Israel, Score has created some of the most recognizable tunes in America ‚Äî most identifiable by just a few notes.<ref name=Score>[https://www.bmi.com/news/entry/20010418_bob_israel_living_an_american_dream_in_studio Bob Israel Living An American Dream in Studio-BMI]</ref>
Among the composers who worked for Score Productions are [[Charles Fox (composer)|Charles Fox]], [[Walt Levinsky]], Arthur B. Rubinstein, Dick Lieb, [[Michel Camilo]], [[Chuck Loeb]], [[Billy Barber (musician)|Billy Barber]], Irving "Benny" Robbin, [[Charles Gross]], Glen Daum, [[Birch Johnson]], and [[Les Fradkin]].
One of the Score-produced compositions, "[[Come on Down (Crystal Waters song)|Come on Down]]", also known as the theme song from ''[[The Price Is Right (U.S. game show)|The Price Is Right]]'', would eventually become a number one hit on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''{{'}}s [[Dance Club Songs]] Chart for [[Crystal Waters]] in 2001. The single also marked the first time that a television theme song (and one that came from a game show) reached number one on a Dance chart, and the first to feature lyrics. <ref>[https://www.allmusic.com/album/come-on-down-mw0000657382 Come on Down-Crystal Waters-AllMusic]</ref>
==Selected credits of Score composers==

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2012}} {{Infobox cricket ground | ground_name = Sir Vivian Richards Stadium | nickname = | image = Sir Vivian Richards Stadium aerial view Oct 2006.jpg | caption = The stadium during construction in October 2006 | country = West Indies | location = North Sound, [[Antigua]], [[Antigua and Barbuda]] | establishment = 2006 | seating_capacity = 10,000 | end1 = Andy Roberts End | end2 = Curtly Ambrose End | international = true | firsttestdate = 30 May‚Äì3 June | firsttestyear = 2008 | firsttesthome = West Indies | firsttestaway = Australia | lasttestdate = 4‚Äì8 July | lasttestyear = 2018 | lasttesthome = West Indies | lasttestaway = Bangladesh | firstodidate = 27 March | firstodiyear = 2007 | firstodihome = West Indies | firstodiaway = Australia | lastodidate = 2 July | lastodiyear = 2017 | lastodihome = West Indies | lastodiaway = India | firstt20idate = 19 May | firstt20iyear = 2010 | firstt20ihome = West Indies | firstt20iaway = South Africa | lastt20idate = 3 March | lastt20iyear = 2013 | lastt20ihome = West Indies | lastt20iaway = Zimbabwe | date = 4 July | year = 2018 | source = http://www.espncricinfo.com/content/ground/208543.html Cricinfo }}
'''Sir Vivian Richards Stadium''' is a [[stadium]] in North Sound, [[Antigua]], [[Antigua and Barbuda]]. It was built for use in the [[2007 Cricket World Cup]] where it hosted Super 8 matches. The stadium usually caters for 10,000 people, but temporary seating doubled its capacity for the 2007 World Cup. The stadium is named after former [[West Indies cricket team|West Indies cricket]] captain [[Viv Richards]].
==Location== The stadium is about 10‚Äì20 minutes' drive from the capital city, [[St. John's, Antigua and Barbuda|St. John's]], and the country's [[VC Bird International Airport|international airport]]. The venue cost approximately US$60 million to build, with the majority of the funds coming from a Chinese Government grant.<ref name="overview">{{cite web |title = Pitch Report ‚Äì Sir Vivian Richards Stadium |url = http://www.cricket365.com/story/0,18305,6575_4915489,00.html |accessdate = 2009-02-14 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090213211127/http://cricket365.com/story/0,18305,6575_4915489,00.html |archivedate = 13 February 2009 |df = dmy-all }}</ref> The first Test match staged on the ground began on 30 May 2008 when the West Indies hosted Australia, with the match ending in a draw.
==Facilities== The stadium constitutes two main stands: the Northern Stand and the five story South Stand. In 2008, the roof of the South Stand was damaged by high winds.<ref name="roofdamage">{{cite web | title = Stolen goods, missing ladies and a flying roof | url = http://content-uk.cricinfo.com/magazine/content/story/370525.html | accessdate = 2009-02-14}}</ref> Other facilities include a practice pitch for the various cricket teams, training infrastructure and a media centre. Sir Viv Richards Stadium is one of the few state-of-the-art venues that encompass underground passageways for the cricket teams to move about in.<ref name="cricinfoprofile">{{cite web | title = Sir Vivian Richards Stadium | url = http://content-uk.cricinfo.com/westindies/content/ground/208543.html | accessdate = 2009-02-14}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Indian Times |title=Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, Antigua |url=http://worldcup.indiatimes.com/Tournament_Home/Venues/Sir_Vivian_Richards_Stadium_Antigua/articleshow/1669950.cms |accessdate=2008-02-14 |work=The Times Of India |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070311223820/http://worldcup.indiatimes.com/Tournament_Home/Venues/Sir_Vivian_Richards_Stadium_Antigua/articleshow/1669950.cms |archivedate=11 March 2007 }}</ref>
Prior to the start of the first Test against [[England cricket team|England]] on 13 April 2015, the north and south ends were renamed for two former West Indies cricketers, [[Curtly Ambrose|Sir Curtly Ambrose]] and [[Andy Roberts (cricketer)|Sir Andy Roberts]].
== Outfield controversy == The ground's second Test match began against England on 13 February 2009, but the [[Battle of the Antigua Sandpit|match was abandoned]] after just ten balls due to the outfield's dangerous condition.
The groundstaff had applied an extra layer of sand after recent heavy rain, and again after a brief shower, which resulted in West Indies bowlers Jerome Taylor and Fidel Edwards being unable to gain a foothold when running in.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12123_4920462,00.html |title=Antigua Test in turmoil |publisher=skysports.com |date=13 February 2009 |accessdate=13 February 2009}}</ref> The sandy nature of the outfield had earnt the ground the nickname of 'Antigua's 366th beach' in the buildup to the game.<ref name="constructioncost">{{cite web | title = Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, North Sound, Antigua | url = http://thatscricket.oneindia.in/news/2007/02/27/2702sir-vivian-richards-stadium-antigua.html | accessdate = 2009-02-14}}</ref>
The abandonment caused great embarrassment for West Indies cricket, with inquiries held by the [[West Indies Cricket Board|WICB]] and the [[International Cricket Council|ICC]]. The ICC ordered that the ground be suspended from staging all international matches for twelve months, and an official warning was issued to the WICB.
== See also == * [[List of international cricket centuries at Sir Vivian Richards Stadium]] * [[List of Test cricket grounds]] * [[Stanford Cricket Ground]]
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links ==
* [http://www.espncricinfo.com/westindies/content/ground/208543.html Cricinfo]
{{coord|17|6|11.79|N|61|47|5.46|W|type:landmark|display=title}}
